Thinks fast to suggest keeping one hostage and releasing the others to de-escalate the situation.
Attempts to reason with Waj about the morality of his actions, showing awareness and emotional intelligence.
Acknowledges being distracted and not fully engaged when confronted by the man in the cafe.
Follows Barry after phone is taken, appears stunned but does not retaliate aggressively.
Attempts to stop Noxious Man from intervening with Heimlich maneuver.
Attempts to communicate urgently with Waj, follows Barry after he runs off, but is stunned and passive when Barry takes his phone and SIM card.
Tries to stop Noxious Man from performing Heimlich maneuver on Barry, showing some awareness but ultimately ineffective.
Legs it, fleeing the scene while others are in distress.
Legs it (runs away) when a situation escalates, ignoring attempts to stop him.
Runs into a phone shop seemingly in a panic or losing control.
Politely asks for a SIM card and insists on getting a phone despite difficulties.
Uses polite language with the phone shop guy and cooperates with the process.
Quickly goes into a phone shop and insists on getting a SIM card and phone despite the model being a display model, shows urgency and decisiveness.

Looks defeated, runs out quickly after a negative interaction.
Looks defeated and runs out, seemingly unable to handle the situation.
Immediately apologizes to Matt after bumping into him.
Shows concern for Matt's condition and tries to communicate clearly.
Deceives Waj and Wat by lying about giving himself up.
Hides from a copter using cover and quickly moves to a crowded street, showing situational awareness.

Instructs Waj to do exactly as he does, attempting to coordinate actions under pressure.

Looks utterly lost and blown away by the explosion, showing genuine emotional response rather than detachment.
Hears the explosion and looks utterly lost and blown away, fighting back tears.

Despite emotional distress, attempts to control the situation by instructing Matt and walking towards the chemist, showing some presence of mind.
